p: Meng et al. [ 148] determined that combining of 1.2 g L −1 nano-ZnO coating with ultrasound treatment at 40KHz prompted a reduced rate of ethylene and CO 2 production, water loss, and texture degradation in fresh-cut kiwi, compared to other treatments at the end of storage. Therefore, this combination represented a promising approach for maintaining the quality of fresh-cut kiwi.
